definition: to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: The child bounced on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩在牀上蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: Four little kangaroos bounced on the bed .
sentences.chinese: 四隻小袋鼠在牀上蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: Jump on the bed like you did as a kid.
sentences.chinese: 像孩子一樣在牀上蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: Joey falls while jumping on the bed and dislocates his arm.
sentences.chinese: 喬伊在牀上蹦蹦跳跳時把手摔到脫臼。

sentences.english: The children bounced into the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們蹦蹦跳跳地進了教室。

sentences.english: The boy squealed in delight bouncing up and down on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 這男孩高興得尖叫，在牀上蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: Kids are gamboling around on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 小朋友在操場中蹦蹦跳跳的。

sentences.english: The little child danced around her at the sight of his mother.
sentences.chinese: 孩子一見到母親就蹦蹦跳跳圍着她轉。

sentences.english: The ball bounces across the ground and rolls up to my feet.
sentences.chinese: 球在地上蹦蹦跳跳着，最後滾落到我的腳下。

sentences.english: Time flutters and fidgets and hops with these birds.
sentences.chinese: 時間同這些鳥兒一起蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: They watched a rabbit lolloping across the road.
sentences.chinese: 他們看着一隻兔子蹦蹦跳跳地橫穿過那條公路。

sentences.english: The pupils are bouncing about on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 小學生們正在操場上蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: They strut and bounce, dance and flounce.
sentences.chinese: 他們昂首闊步，蹦蹦跳跳。
一會兒，一隻小兔蹦蹦跳跳來了。

sentences.english: The little girl skipping along at her mother's side.
sentences.chinese: 這個小女孩在她媽旁邊蹦蹦跳跳地往前走。

sentences.english: Brandt is off again, skipping like a mountain goat.
sentences.chinese: 布蘭德再次走開，蹦蹦跳跳地像個山羊。

definition: hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
to look in all directions (idiom)/to glance around
to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]
